content: I'm glad you found the tips helpful! I've been experimenting with different techniques to prevent fungal diseases on my tomato plants, and I've had some success with using copper oxychloride to treat fungal infections. I've also been making sure to remove any infected leaves and stems to prevent the disease from spreading. Do you think it's a good idea to use a drip irrigation system to deliver water directly to the roots of the plants, rather than getting the leaves wet? I've heard that this can help prevent fungal diseases.
